title: Greatest Common Factor
text: The greatest common factor (GCF) of two numbers is the largest number that divides evenly into both numbers.
speech: The greatest common factor (GCF) of two numbers is the largest number that divides evenly into both numbers.
pacedSpeech: The greatest common factor (GCF) of two numbers is the largest number that divides evenly into both numbers.

title: Example of a GCF
text: $$4$$ is the GCF of $$16$$ and $$20$$ because it is the largest number that divides evenly into both $$16$$ and $$20$$.
speech: 4  is the GCF of  16  and  20  because it is the largest number that divides evenly into both  16  and  20 .
pacedSpeech: because it is the largest number that divides evenly into both   16

title: Factor of Expression
speech: b squared minus a,  divides evenly into both terms.

title: Example of Factoring
text: $$y\left(x+2\right)$$ + $$3\left(x+2\right)$$ $$=$$ $$\left(y+3\right) \left(x+2\right)$$, in which the GCF of the original expression is $$x+2$$.
speech: y, parentheses x plus 2,   + , 3 times, parentheses x plus 2,    is equal to   parentheses y plus 3,  times, parentheses x plus 2,  , in which the GCF of the original expression is  x plus 2 .
pacedSpeech: , in which the GCF of the original expression is   x plus 2
